repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
As the InspectTree buffer is now a valid tree-sitter query tree, we can use the bundled fold queries to have folding for the tree.

With a tree of
```
(translation_unit ; [0, 0] - [6, 0]
  (preproc_def ; [0, 0] - [1, 0]
    name: (identifier)) ; [0, 8] - [0, 11]
  (declaration ; [3, 0] - [5, 6]
    type: (struct_specifier ; [3, 0] - [5, 1]
      body: (field_declaration_list ; [3, 7] - [5, 1]
        (field_declaration ; [4, 0] - [4, 16]
          type: (macro_type_specifier ; [4, 0] - [4, 15]
            name: (identifier) ; [4, 0] - [4, 7]
            (ERROR ; [4, 8] - [4, 11]
              (number_literal)) ; [4, 8] - [4, 10]
            type: (type_descriptor ; [4, 12] - [4, 15]
              type: (type_identifier)))))) ; [4, 12] - [4, 15]
    declarator: (identifier))) ; [5, 2] - [5, 5]
```

We will have the folded tree of 
```
(translation_unit ; [0, 0] - [6, 0]
  (preproc_def ; [0, 0] - [1, 0]
    name: (identifier)) ; [0, 8] - [0, 11]
  (declaration ; [3, 0] - [5, 6] .................................
```

comment_data.body: I'm not sure this worked because I get folding.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -159,7 +159,10 @@ end
 local function set_dev_properties(w, b)
   vim.wo[w].scrolloff = 5
   vim.wo[w].wrap = false
-  vim.wo[w].foldmethod = 'manual' -- disable folding

comment_data.body: I don't really know but that's possibly because `foldmethod` set during startup is before this line
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -159,7 +159,10 @@ end
 local function set_dev_properties(w, b)
   vim.wo[w].scrolloff = 5
   vim.wo[w].wrap = false
-  vim.wo[w].foldmethod = 'manual' -- disable folding

comment_data.body: So does that mean the options below are also ignored?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -159,7 +159,10 @@ end
 local function set_dev_properties(w, b)
   vim.wo[w].scrolloff = 5
   vim.wo[w].wrap = false
-  vim.wo[w].foldmethod = 'manual' -- disable folding

comment_data.body: I think it's because `filetype` is set last. We may want to set that first? I'm not sure though, the code doesn't describe the intent here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -159,7 +159,10 @@ end
 local function set_dev_properties(w, b)
   vim.wo[w].scrolloff = 5
   vim.wo[w].wrap = false
-  vim.wo[w].foldmethod = 'manual' -- disable folding

comment_data.body: I don't think there was much intent, it just didn't matter before (@gpanders ?); setting filetype first and _then_  adding options certainly makes sense.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -159,7 +159,10 @@ end
 local function set_dev_properties(w, b)
   vim.wo[w].scrolloff = 5
   vim.wo[w].wrap = false
-  vim.wo[w].foldmethod = 'manual' -- disable folding

comment_data.body: No. This is still set. The tree also doesn't fold until one press zc/zC/za/zA
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -159,7 +159,10 @@ end
 local function set_dev_properties(w, b)
   vim.wo[w].scrolloff = 5
   vim.wo[w].wrap = false
-  vim.wo[w].foldmethod = 'manual' -- disable folding

comment_data.body: I think it's because I set treesitter folds in a filetype autocmd.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -159,7 +159,10 @@ end
 local function set_dev_properties(w, b)
   vim.wo[w].scrolloff = 5
   vim.wo[w].wrap = false
-  vim.wo[w].foldmethod = 'manual' -- disable folding

comment_data.body: Running `nvim --clean src/nlua0.c -c` doesn't fold automatically. So I don't think this is an issue with the PR
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -159,7 +159,10 @@ end
 local function set_dev_properties(w, b)
   vim.wo[w].scrolloff = 5
   vim.wo[w].wrap = false
-  vim.wo[w].foldmethod = 'manual' -- disable folding

comment_data.body:
Yes, but it might be a problem with typical setups.

Applying options in filetype autocmds is a pretty common (and recommended?) idiom, so whatever we do here needs to take that into account. Whether we override user config or not should be an intentional behaviour.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -159,7 +159,10 @@ end
 local function set_dev_properties(w, b)
   vim.wo[w].scrolloff = 5
   vim.wo[w].wrap = false
-  vim.wo[w].foldmethod = 'manual' -- disable folding

comment_data.body:
>Applying options in filetype autocmds is a pretty common (and recommended?) idiom, so whatever we do here needs to take that into account. Whether we override user config or not should be an intentional behaviour.

My gut says we should set the "default" settings here which can be overriden by a filetype autocommand or ftplugin, if desired. Which means this PR is correct as-is.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -159,7 +159,10 @@ end
 local function set_dev_properties(w, b)
   vim.wo[w].scrolloff = 5
   vim.wo[w].wrap = false
-  vim.wo[w].foldmethod = 'manual' -- disable folding

comment_data.body:
It would be nice if the code showed this intent better.

A simple comment would do.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -159,7 +159,10 @@ end
 local function set_dev_properties(w, b)
   vim.wo[w].scrolloff = 5
   vim.wo[w].wrap = false
-  vim.wo[w].foldmethod = 'manual' -- disable folding

comment_regular_data.body: I really dislike this. I've recently modified my dotfiles to explicitly disable folding on inspectree, since by default it opens with everything collapsed

A compromise would be to set `foldlevel` very, very high? (Personally, I'm with lewis -- I hate folding with a passion. I would veto folding by default as well.)

I do see the use of being able to fold nodes, though; these trees can be quite unwieldy. It's just the default I'm concerned with.
I like folding, but specifically when I want to see inspectree, I want the cursor to not be on a closed fold.
Lint failing. Can merge once it's fixed.

Should we mention something in the help? Or news.txt?

```diff
diff --git a/runtime/doc/treesitter.txt b/runtime/doc/treesitter.txt
index 4ac236a138df..30aaa5554e4e 100644
--- a/runtime/doc/treesitter.txt
+++ b/runtime/doc/treesitter.txt
@@ -831,7 +831,7 @@ inspect_tree({opts})                           *vim.treesitter.inspect_tree()*
     While in the window, press "a" to toggle display of anonymous nodes, "I"
     to toggle the display of the source language of each node, "o" to toggle
     the query editor, and press <Enter> to jump to the node under the cursor
-    in the source buffer.
+    in the source buffer. Folding also works (try |zo|, |zc|, etc.).
 
     Can also be shown with `:InspectTree`.                      *:InspectTree*
 ```
